name: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. John Randolph PRINCE, III, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Office of Disciplinary Counsel v. Prince

parties: OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. John Randolph PRINCE, III, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 22nd day of September, 2003, there having been filed with this Court by John Randolph Prince, III, his verified Statement of Resignation dated July 24, 2003, stating that he desires to resign from the Bar of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in accordance with the provisions of Rule 215, Pa.R.D.E., it is
ORDERED that the resignation of John Randolph Prince, III, be and it is hereby accepted and he is DISBARRED ON CONSENT from the Bar of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania;- and it is further ORDERED that he shall comply with the provisions of Rule 217, Pa.R.D.E. Respondent shall pay costs, if any, to the Disciplinary Board pursuant to Rule 208(g), Pa.R.D.E.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
839 A.2d 168
OFFICE OF DISCIPLINARY COUNSEL, Petitioner, v. John Randolph PRINCE, III, Respondent.
No. 99 DB 2003.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Sept. 22, 2003.
